conclusion: Analyze the given velocity-time graphs of both the pedestrian and the bus.
The pedestrian's velocity-time graph is a straight line with a slope of 8 m/s.
The bus's velocity-time graph is a straight line with a slope of 8 m/s as well.
The pedestrian is initially 36 meters away from the bus.
The bus is initially at rest.
The bus starts moving at t = 8 seconds.
The pedestrian starts moving at t = 0 seconds.
The bus's speed is also 8 m/s.
The pedestrian's speed is greater than the bus's speed.
Therefore, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
Final Answer: Yes, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
